授業目的: The objective of this course is for students to understand business-related research, particularly in the marketing area.
到達目標:
After completing this course, students will be able to explain:
1. The elements of research proposal and research process
2. Various research designs and methods of data collection
3. Distinguish between a good research and the one that falls short of professional quality
4. To prepare a feasible and worthwhile research proposal.
授業方法:
Online Format: Simultaneous and Two-way.
The course material including the elements of the research proposal and the relevant research articles will be available at LUNA.
Class discussions and reviews of published research articles available in leading journals and/or industry reports will facilitate understanding of the research process and preparation of a research proposal. Active participation and contributions to the class discussion are critical for satisfactory completion of this course. An article review is designed to familiarize students with the research structure and evaluate the contents. Students will apply the acquired knowledge to prepare a research proposal and make a class presentation at the end of this course.

第1回: Introduction to Business and Management Research
The students are required to read course material at LUNA and prepare Assignment 1.
第2回: The Elements of a Research Proposal
The students are required to read course material at LUNA and prepare Assignment 1.
第3回: Formulating and Clarifying your Research Topic
第4回: The students will search for two articles relevant to their research interest
第9回: Primary Data through Observation, Semi-structured, In-depth and Group Interviews
第10回: To prepare a draft of the research proposal
第14回: Review and reflection on a feasible and worthwhile research project in relation to Individual Research preparation.
トピック.授業外学習2: It is essential for students to have completed the course on Statistic and/or Business Analytics before taking this course.  The students are expected to read the course material assigned for each week before the class and prepare to actively participate in class discussions. The class discussions will focus on students’ research interests, the assigned reading material, and the review of published research articles.

評価.教科書Required texts0:
Mark Saunders, Philip Lewis & Andrian Thornhill, Research Methods for Business Students, 5th Edition, Prentice-Hall, July 2009.

A selected article will be discussed at the beginning of the course to familiarize students with research structure and contents. Students are then expected to choose and review two articles relevant to their research interest in class discussions.
